yaml.title: Maik Bieleke
yaml.subtitle: Senior Researcher | Laboratory Head | Data Scientist

markdown.headingText: {{< iconify fluent megaphone-loud-16-filled >}} Out now: The Handbook of Boredom
markdown.markdown: ::: {#about-me style="text-align: center;"} I'm a senior researcher, laboratory head, and data scientist in the [sport psychology lab](https://www.sportwissenschaft.uni-konstanz.de/schueler/schueler/research/sport-psychology-lab/){.external target="_blank"} at the University of Konstanz, Germany. My interestes include human motivation, effort, and performance in basic and applied research. I passionately use R for data science and in my general workflow. ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="65%"} With contributions from boredom researchers across various disciplines, this book provides a unique and comprehensive exploration of boredom. Contents: - Foundations: Overview of a multitude of theoretical, conceptual, historical, and methodological aspects of boredom. - Correlates: Exploration of the properties of boredom and its links to self-control, mind-wandering, flow, and aggression. - Contexts: Insights into boredom in various life domains and its role for health, well-being, and aesthetic experience. Bonus: The final chapter is a collective effort of all contributors, offering a panoramic view of the field and outlining its future directions. Check it out {{< iconify bi box-arrow-up-right >}} ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="25%"} [![The Handbook of Boredom, edited by Maik Bieleke, Wanja Wolff, & Corinna Martarelli.](assets/images/boredom-book.png)](https://www.routledge.com/The-Routledge-International-Handbook-of-Boredom/Bieleke-Wolff-Martarelli/p/book/9781032221861) ::: ::: :::
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml: ::: {#about-me style="text-align: center;"} I'm a senior researcher, laboratory head, and data scientist in the [sport psychology lab](https://www.sportwissenschaft.uni-konstanz.de/schueler/schueler/research/sport-psychology-lab/){.external target="_blank"} at the University of Konstanz, Germany. My interestes include human motivation, effort, and performance in basic and applied research. I passionately use R for data science and in my general workflow. ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false"} ## {{< iconify fluent megaphone-loud-16-filled >}} Out now: The Handbook of Boredom ::: columns ::: {.column width="65%"} With contributions from boredom researchers across various disciplines, this book provides a unique and comprehensive exploration of boredom. Contents: - Foundations: Overview of a multitude of theoretical, conceptual, historical, and methodological aspects of boredom. - Correlates: Exploration of the properties of boredom and its links to self-control, mind-wandering, flow, and aggression. - Contexts: Insights into boredom in various life domains and its role for health, well-being, and aesthetic experience. Bonus: The final chapter is a collective effort of all contributors, offering a panoramic view of the field and outlining its future directions. Check it out {{< iconify bi box-arrow-up-right >}} ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="25%"} [![The Handbook of Boredom, edited by Maik Bieleke, Wanja Wolff, & Corinna Martarelli.](assets/images/boredom-book.png)](https://www.routledge.com/The-Routledge-International-Handbook-of-Boredom/Bieleke-Wolff-Martarelli/p/book/9781032221861) ::: ::: :::
